title: Genre Integration: Choosing Reading Strategy
objective: Select appropriate strategy based on genre and context

required_passages.text: Jesus says, I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser. Every fruitful branch is pruned to bear more fruit, and branches that do not remain are removed. Abide in Me and My words in you, for apart from Me you can do nothing. Abiding leads to fruit, obedience, and fullness of joy.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson twelve. We integrate genre knowledge to choose reading strategy.

Listen to the passage. John 15:1-11. Jesus says, I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser. Every fruitful branch is pruned to bear more fruit, and branches that do not remain are removed. Abide in Me and My words in you, for apart from Me you can do nothing. Abiding leads to fruit, obedience, and fullness of joy. Now identify where Jesus uses metaphor and how the discourse applies that imagery.
Genre determines whether to seek propositional statements, symbolic meaning, or narrative implication. Match method to form.
When in doubt, prioritize author's apparent intent and original audience's likely reception. Document your reasoning.

What informs your choice of reading strategy?
segments.correct_answer: The genre and context of the passage

segments.audio_script: This completes lesson twelve. Next unit begins theological interpretation and synthesis.

vocabulary.definition: Approach that tailors interpretive method to a text's literary type

study_notes: Always state why a reading strategy fits the text; transparent reasoning aids critique and revision.
